meanings.definition: To kill or destroy excessively or to an unnecessary extent.
meanings.sent1: The hunter overkilled the deer by shooting it multiple times.
meanings.sent2: The gardener overkilled the plants by watering them too much.
meanings.sent3: The chef overkilled the pasta by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: Her strict diet overkilled her enjoyment of food.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display was overkilled with too many explosions.

meanings.definition: To use excessive force or effort in dealing with something.
meanings.sent1: The wrestler overkilled his opponent by using unnecessary strength.
meanings.sent2: She overkilled the jar lid by trying to open it with too much force.
meanings.sent3: The student overkilled the math problem by using a complicated formula.
meanings.sent4: The detective overkilled the investigation by questioning everyone multiple times.
meanings.sent5: The chef overkilled the dough by kneading it too aggressively.

meanings.definition: To cause something to lose its effectiveness by doing too much of it.
meanings.sent1: The comedian overkilled the joke by repeating it too many times.
meanings.sent2: The teacher overkilled the lesson by going over the same topic repeatedly.
meanings.sent3: The singer overkilled the song by adding unnecessary high notes.
meanings.sent4: The painter overkilled the canvas by layering too many colors.
meanings.sent5: The athlete overkilled the training by exhausting themselves before the competition.
